meanings.definition: To cause to be out of proportion.
meanings.sent1: She kept disproportionating the sizes of the shapes in her drawing.
meanings.sent2: The tailor was disproportionating the sleeves of the jacket to fit the customer perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to disproportionate the ingredients in the recipe resulted in a comically large cake.
meanings.sent4: His constant need to disproportionate every situation made him the black sheep of the family.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes disproportionated the colors on the canvas, creating a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.sent1: The construction worker was disproportionating the lengths of the wooden planks for the fence.
meanings.sent2: The budget cuts were disproportionating the resources allocated to the project.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to disproportionate the sizes of his props backfired hilariously.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions seemed to disproportionate with the situation, causing confusion among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds disproportionated the branches of the trees, creating a chaotic scene.
